Name: inspircd
Overview: InspIRCd is a modular Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server written in C++

domainname.Name: Domainname
domainname.Description: Suffix used behind the server name (in this format '.example.com')

dnsbls.Name: DNSBLs
dnsbls.Description: Set to no to disable DNSBLs (DNS-based block list - set to 'yes' or 'no')

connectionpassword.Name: Connection Password
connectionpassword.Description:
Password either as plaintext, or hash value - if you don't want a password leave this variable empty
(Make sure you escape special chars like $ or & if needed)

connectionpasswordhashingalgorithm.Name: Connection Password Hashing algorithm
connectionpasswordhashingalgorithm.Description: Hashing algorithm for the Connection Password  - if you don't entered a password leave this variable empty (e.g. hmac-sha256, hmac-md5, hmac-ripemd160, md5, ripemd160, sha256)

operatorhost.Name: Operator Host
operatorhost.Description: Hosts allowed to oper up (If you don't want to connect OP's from outside change for example to '*@localhost' or what your hostname matches that the OP should connect)

operatorpasswordhash.Name: Operator Password Hash
operatorpasswordhash.Description: Hash value for your oper password hash (to generate a password hash create the server without the hash, connect to the InspIRCd and type in: '/mkpasswd HASHMALGORITHM PASSORD' eg: '/mkpasswd hmac-sha256 superstronpassword')

operatorpasswordhashingalgorithm.Name: Operator Password Hashing algorithm
operatorpasswordhashingalgorithm.Description: Hashing algorithm for the Operator Password - if you don't entered a password leave this variable empty (e.g. hmac-sha256, hmac-md5, hmac-ripemd160, md5, ripemd160, sha256)

operatorsslonly.Name: Operator SSL Only
operatorsslonly.Description: Allow oper up only while using TLS (set to 'yes' or 'no')

certificate-mailadress.Name: Certificate - Mail Adress
certificate-mailadress.Description: Mail address represented in the certificate

certificate-contry.Name: Certificate - Contry
certificate-contry.Description: Country Code by ISO 3166-1 (to get the country code visit: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1)

services-connectionaddress.Name: Services - Connection Address
services-connectionaddress.Description: Specify the IP Address from where the Services are connecting (if you run Anope on the same Unraid machine it is usually the IP address of Unraid)

services-cidrallowmask.Name: Services - CIDR Allow Mask
services-cidrallowmask.Description: CIDR of services source IP (If you run your Services on the same Network as your IRCd you don't have to fill in this value)

services-hidden.Name: Services - Hidden
services-hidden.Description: Hide services from /MAP and /LINKS (valid options are: 'yes' or 'no', change only if you know what you are doing!)

services-tls.Name: Services - TLS
services-tls.Description: Turn on TLS encryption for the Services link (this is be no proble if you connect it to your internal network since it only talks internally to your Services).

services-password.Name: Services - Password
services-password.Description: Password send by this server and send by the services

datapath.Name: Data Path
datapath.Description: Your configuration is located in '.../conf/' (WARNING: change the main configurations via the variables here and not the files which say that you should don't edit them)

tcp3-server,plaintext.Name: TCP3 - Server, Plaintext
tcp3-server,plaintext.Description: TCP Server Port (Unencrypted - You don't have to forward this port if you use this as a standalone IRC Server)

tcp4-server,tls.Name: TCP4 - Server, TLS
tcp4-server,tls.Description: TCP Server Port (Encrypted - You don't have to forward this port if you use this as a standalone IRC Server)
